document.masterDocTitle: Belgopeltula belgica (Vincx & Gourbault, 1992) gen. et comb. nov. and Mudwigglus micramphidium sp. nov. from the west coast of Sweden, and reappraisal of the genus Pseudaraeolaimus Chitwood, 1951 (Nematoda: Araeolaimida: Diplopeltidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Belgopeltula belgica (Vincx & Gourbault, 1992) gen. et comb. nov. and Mudwigglus micramphidium sp. nov. from the west coast of Sweden, and reappraisal of the genus Pseudaraeolaimus Chitwood, 1951 (Nematoda: Araeolaimida: Diplopeltidae)

subSubSection.paragraph: See Table 4 for additional diagnostic characters.

paragraph.keyLead:
1. Amphidial fovea a transverse slit; cuticle with ten longitudinal ridges ....
Edalonema Andrássy, 2007

– Amphidial fovea double-loop-shaped in male, unispiral in female ..................
Belgopeltula
gen. nov.

2. Basal bulb absent; freshwater or terrestrial ........................................
Cylindrolaimus de Man, 1880

– Two ovaries (anterior and posterior) .......................................................
Southerniella Allgén, 1932
4. Oral opening shifted to the ventral body side ............................ Morlaxia Vincx & Gourbault, 1988

5. Basal pharyngeal bulb present; ovaries antidromously reflexed ...............
Mudwigglus Leduc, 2013

8. Anterior body region abruptly narrowing; amphid at a distance equal to more than five labial region diameters from the anterior end .............................................
Metaraeolaimoides De Coninck, 1936

– Anterior body region cylindrical or subcylindrical; amphid at a distance equal to less than two labial region diameters from the anterior end ............................................................................................. 9

keyStep.keyLead:
9. Buccal cavity cup-shaped; pronounced sexual dimorphism in the amphid size (large in males and small in females) ..................................................................................
Pararaeolaimus Timm, 1961

– Buccal cavity conical; no sexual dimorphism in the amphid size ..........
Araeolaimus de Man, 1888

caption.paragraph: Table 4. Selected diagnostic characters of genera of the family Diplopeltidae Filipjev, 1918 based on literature data supplemented with recent observations (modified after Tchesunov & Miljutina 2008 ).

tr.td: double loop in male, unispiral in female
with fusiform corpus and narrow postcorpus

paragraph.keyLead: – Cervical (paramphideal) setae present; caudal glands open via common spinneret ........................11

– Refractive subcuticular plate absent ..........................................
Pseudaraeolaimus Chitwood, 1951
